sentences: Rosa García Ascot (8 April 1902 in Madrid – 2 May 2002 in Torrelaguna, Madrid) was a Spanish composer and pianist.
She married Bal y Gay in 1933.
García Ascot was an exponent of Manuel de Falla's music as a concert pianist and is also considered the latter's last disciple.
Before studying with de Falla in Madrid, she was a pupil of Felipe Pedrell, and later studied with Enrique Granados.
She spent 10 years in the early part of her career actively touring as a concert soloist and recitalist.
She died almost a month after her 100th birthday.
